description: Pottery jug; so-called woman and pitcher vase; jug of high narrow form, with wide foot and attenuated neck; on the front of the shoulder is a female figure in long tunic, with high peaked headdress holding a trefoil lip jug, perforated to act as a spout. "The general effect is that the woman seated at the spout presides over the business of puring." The decoration is in black enhanced by dots and lines of white; fine state of preservation
title: Jug
